title: Visual Studio Team Services Deployments
name: auth0-visualstudio-deploy
author: auth0

REPOSITORY.description: The project from which you want to deploy rules and database scripts. To use a specific repository within a project, format your input value as follows: `projectName/repoName`.

BRANCH.description: The branch we should monitor for commits

PROJECT_PATH.description: The path we should monitor for commits

INSTANCE.description: Your Visual Studio Team Services/Azure DevOps organization name (without .visualstudio.com or dev.azure.com)

USERNAME.description: Your Visual Studio Team Services / Azure DevOps username

AUTH_METHOD.description: You can choose between PAT and Basic (Alternate authentication credentials)

PASSWORD.description: Your Visual Studio / Azure DevOps password (Alternate authentication credentials)

TOKEN.description: Your personal access token for Visual Studio Team Services / Azure DevOps

BASE_DIR.description: Path to your tenant settings directories

AUTO_REDEPLOY.description: Automatically re-deploy last successful configuration in case of failed deploy

AUTH0_ALLOW_DELETE.description: Allows the extension to delete objects that does not exist within the repository.

SLACK_INCOMING_WEBHOOK_URL.description: Webhook URL for Slack used to notify you of successful and failed deployments

BATCH_SIZE.description: The amount of logs to batch before sending. A single cron execution will send multiple batches.

START_FROM.description: Checkpoint ID of log to start from.

SLACK_SEND_SUCCESS.description: This setting will enable verbose notifications to Slack which are useful for troubleshooting

AUTH0_API_ENDPOINTS.description: Allows you to filter specific API endpoints, comma separated.
AUTH0_API_ENDPOINTS.example: e.g.: users, connections, rules, emails, stats, clients, tenants

SEND_AS_BATCH.description: If enabled, extension will send entire batch in one request. Otherwise, it will send requests one by one.

WEBHOOK_CONCURRENT_CALLS.description: The maximum concurrent calls that will be made to your webhook
